meanings.definition: An extremely long period of time in Hindu and Buddhist cosmology.
meanings.sent1: In Hindu stories, it took countless kalpas for the universe to be created.
meanings.sent2: The concept of kalpas helps us understand the vastness of time in ancient beliefs.
meanings.sent3: After waiting for what felt like kalpas, the bus finally arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her patience seemed to last for kalpas, never running out.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation of the topic felt like it lasted for kalpas, but it was very informative.

meanings.definition: A unit of time in Hindu and Buddhist cosmology, equivalent to 4.32 billion years.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the concept of kalpas to understand the immense duration of time.
meanings.sent2: One kalpas is a mind-bogglingly long period in ancient time measurements.
meanings.sent3: Waiting for the weekend to arrive felt like it would take a kalpas.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood tall, witnessing the passing of kalpas.
meanings.sent5: The journey through space felt like traveling through countless kalpas of time.

meanings.sent1: There were kalpas of stars twinkling in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The library contained kalpas of books waiting to be read.
meanings.sent3: She had to bake kalpas of cookies for the school fundraiser.
meanings.sent4: The old tree had witnessed kalpas of changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The ocean held kalpas of secrets in its depths, waiting to be discovered.
